feed.title: Tailwind CSS Blog
feed.subtitle: All the latest Tailwind CSS news, straight from the team.

entry.title: Vanilla JavaScript support for Tailwind Plus
entry.id: Vanilla JavaScript support for Tailwind Plus
entry.summary: Every UI block in Tailwind Plus is now fully functional, accessible, and interactive, even if you don't use a framework like React or Vue.

entry.title: Compass: A starter kit for online courses
entry.id: Compass: A starter kit for online courses
entry.summary: I've been itching to get back into screencasting and teaching lately, and the natural first step was to build our own course platform. So we just released Compass, a Next.js starter kit for publishing your own online course.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v4.1: Text shadows, masks, and tons more
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v4.1: Text shadows, masks, and tons more
entry.summary: I wasn't sure it would ever happen but we did it — we released a version of Tailwind CSS that includes text shadow utilities. Tailwind CSS v4.1 is here and it's packed with improvements that will help you (or your LLM, you coward) build even better interactive experiences.

entry.title: Tailwind UI is now Tailwind Plus
entry.id: Tailwind UI is now Tailwind Plus
entry.summary: We just shipped a huge rebrand project, turning what was previously known as Tailwind UI into Tailwind Plus. Tailwind Plus is the all same high-quality resources you know from Tailwind UI, but with all-new possibilities and potential.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v4.0
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v4.0
entry.summary: We just released Tailwind CSS v4.0 — an all-new version of the framework optimized for performance and flexibility, with a reimagined configuration and customization experience, and taking full advantage of the latest advancements the web platform has to offer.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v4.0 Beta 1
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v4.0 Beta 1
entry.summary: After a long alpha period, we're excited to release the first public beta of Tailwind CSS v4.0.

entry.title: Radiant: A beautiful new marketing site template
entry.id: Radiant: A beautiful new marketing site template
entry.summary: Over the past couple of months we’ve been working away at a new SaaS template called Radiant and it’s out now as part of Tailwind UI.

entry.title: Headless UI v2.1: Simplified transition API and improved multi-dialog support
entry.id: Headless UI v2.1: Simplified transition API and improved multi-dialog support

entry.title: Automatically clean up whitespace and duplicate class names
entry.id: Automatically clean up whitespace and duplicate class names
entry.summary: We just released a new version of prettier-plugin-tailwindcss which adds support for removing unnecessary whitespace and duplicate classes when sorting.

entry.title: Catalyst: Application layouts, navigation menus, description lists, and more
entry.id: Catalyst: Application layouts, navigation menus, description lists, and more
entry.summary: We just published the first major update to Catalyst since releasing the development preview, with two new application layouts, navbar and sidebar components, description lists, and more.

entry.title: Headless UI v2.0 for React
entry.id: Headless UI v2.0 for React
entry.summary: We just released Headless UI v2.0 for React which includes a ton of new stuff including built-in anchor positioning, a new headless checkbox component, HTML form components and more!

entry.title: We're hiring a Design Engineer + Staff Engineer
entry.id: We're hiring a Design Engineer + Staff Engineer
entry.summary: We just tagged the first public v4.0.0-alpha so you can start experimenting with it and help us get to a stable release later this year.

entry.title: Open-sourcing our progress on Tailwind CSS v4.0
entry.id: Open-sourcing our progress on Tailwind CSS v4.0
entry.summary: We just tagged the first public v4.0.0-alpha so you can start experimenting with it and help us get to a stable release later this year.

entry.title: Introducing Catalyst: A modern UI kit for React
entry.id: Introducing Catalyst: A modern UI kit for React
entry.summary: We just released the first development preview of Catalyst, our new fully-componentized, batteries-included application UI kit for React.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v3.4: Dynamic viewport units, :has() support, balanced headlines, subgrid, and more
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v3.4: Dynamic viewport units, :has() support, balanced headlines, subgrid, and more
entry.summary: There’s nothing like building a major new product for finding all the features you wish you had in your own tools, so we capitalized on that inspiration and turned it into this — Tailwind CSS v3.4.

entry.title: Heroicons Micro: What are these, icons for ants?
entry.id: Heroicons Micro: What are these, icons for ants?
entry.summary: We just released Heroicons v2.1 which includes a brand new micro style — a full set of almost three hundred 16×16 icons designed for tighter, higher density UIs.

entry.title: Meet Studio: Our beautiful new agency site template
entry.id: Meet Studio: Our beautiful new agency site template
entry.summary: We just released Studio — a beautiful new agency website template we've been working on for the last couple of months for Tailwind UI.

entry.title: Tailwind Connect 2023: Recap of our first in-person event
entry.id: Tailwind Connect 2023: Recap of our first in-person event
entry.summary: Last month, over 200 people got together in my hometown of Cambridge, Ontario to hang out, talk shop, and get a peek behind the curtain at some of the new stuff we've been working on.

entry.title: New changelog template + the biggest Tailwind UI update ever
entry.id: New changelog template + the biggest Tailwind UI update ever
entry.summary: Over the last four months we've probably done more work on Tailwind UI than we ever have, and having finally wrapped up what we set out to achieve I'm excited to lay it all out for you.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v3.3: Extended color palette, ESM/TS support, logical properties, and more
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v3.3: Extended color palette, ESM/TS support, logical properties, and more
entry.summary: Tailwind CSS v3.3 is here — bringing a bunch of new features people have been asking for forever, and a bunch of new stuff you didn't even know you wanted.

entry.title: Protocol: A beautiful starting point for your next API documentation site
entry.id: Protocol: A beautiful starting point for your next API documentation site
entry.summary: It's been months in the making but I'm excited to finally release our next website template — Protocol, a beautiful starter kit for building amazing API reference websites.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v3.2: Dynamic breakpoints, multi-config, and container queries, oh my!
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v3.2: Dynamic breakpoints, multi-config, and container queries, oh my!
entry.summary: ...and nested group support, `aria-*` variants, `data-*` variants, `@supports` support, and more.

entry.title: We built you a new personal website + Heroicons v2.0, Headless UI v1.7, and more
entry.id: We built you a new personal website + Heroicons v2.0, Headless UI v1.7, and more
entry.summary: We just released a stunning new personal website template for Tailwind UI, redesigned Heroicons from scratch, tagged a new version of Headless UI with some exciting new features, and more.

entry.title: New Tailwind CSS + Framer Motion template and Tailwind Jobs
entry.id: New Tailwind CSS + Framer Motion template and Tailwind Jobs
entry.summary: All about the brand new Tailwind UI template we just shipped, the official Tailwind CSS job board, and a bunch of new projects coming out in the next few weeks.

entry.title: Tailwind UI: Site templates and all-access
entry.id: Tailwind UI: Site templates and all-access
entry.summary: Today we're releasing our first batch of official Tailwind CSS website templates — beautiful designs engineered into production-quality codebases, powered by Tailwind CSS and Next.js.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v3.1: You wanna get nuts? Come on, let's get nuts!
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v3.1: You wanna get nuts? Come on, let's get nuts!
entry.summary: Now with first-party TypeScript types, arbitrary variants, improved CSS variable DX, and tons more.

entry.title: Headless UI v1.6, Tailwind UI team management, Tailwind Play improvements, and more
entry.id: Headless UI v1.6, Tailwind UI team management, Tailwind Play improvements, and more
entry.summary: It's been a while since I've written about what we've been working on so I have a lot to share! Too much honestly — so put your swim suit on, sit back in your lounge chair, and prepare to soak up some vitamin CSS.

entry.title: Headless UI v1.5: The One With Comboboxes
entry.id: Headless UI v1.5: The One With Comboboxes
entry.summary: We just released Headless UI v1.5, which includes a brand new `Combobox` component.

entry.title: Automatic Class Sorting with Prettier
entry.id: Automatic Class Sorting with Prettier
entry.summary: People have been talking about the best way to sort your utility classes in Tailwind projects for at least four years. Today we’re excited to announce that you can finally stop worrying about it with the release of our official Prettier plugin for Tailwind CSS.

entry.title: Effortless Typography, Even in Dark Mode
entry.id: Effortless Typography, Even in Dark Mode
entry.summary: Today we're announcing the next version of the Tailwind CSS Typography plugin, which brings easy dark mode support and a brand new customization API.

entry.title: Standalone CLI: Use Tailwind CSS without Node.js
entry.id: Standalone CLI: Use Tailwind CSS without Node.js
entry.summary: Today we're announcing a new standalone CLI build that gives you the full power of Tailwind CLI in a self-contained executable — no Node.js or npm required.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v3.0
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v3.0
entry.summary: Tailwind CSS v3.0 is here — bringing incredible performance gains, huge workflow improvements, and a seriously ridiculous number of new features.

entry.title: Introducing Tailwind UI Ecommerce
entry.id: Introducing Tailwind UI Ecommerce
entry.summary: Almost 6 months in the making, we finally released Tailwind UI Ecommerce — the first all-new component kit for Tailwind UI since the initial launch back in February 2020.

entry.title: Headless UI v1.4: The One With Tabs
entry.id: Headless UI v1.4: The One With Tabs
entry.summary: We just released Headless UI v1.4, which includes a brand new `Tab` component, and new APIs for manually closing `Popover` and `Disclosure` components more easily.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v2.2
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v2.2
entry.summary: An all-new high-performance CLI tool, ::before and ::after support, sibling selectors, selected text variants, and tons more.

entry.title: Tailwind UI: Now with React + Vue support
entry.id: Tailwind UI: Now with React + Vue support
entry.summary: Last year we released Tailwind UI — a huge directory of professionally designed UI examples built with Tailwind CSS. Today we’re excited to add first class support for React and Vue 3 to all of the examples in Tailwind UI, which makes it even easier to adapt them for your projects.

entry.title: Headless UI v1.0
entry.id: Headless UI v1.0
entry.summary: Last fall we announced Headless UI, a library of completely unstyled, fully accessible UI components, designed to pair perfectly with Tailwind CSS. Today we’re super excited to release Headless UI v1.0, which more than doubles the amount of included components for both React and Vue.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v2.1
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v2.1
entry.summary: We just released Tailwind CSS v2.1 which brings the new JIT engine to core, adds first-class CSS filter support, and more!

entry.title: Heroicons v1.0
entry.id: Heroicons v1.0
entry.summary: Today we're releasing Heroicons v1.0, which includes over 450+ free icons in two styles, official React and Vue libraries, and Figma assets.

entry.title: Just-In-Time: The Next Generation of Tailwind CSS
entry.id: Just-In-Time: The Next Generation of Tailwind CSS
entry.summary: One of the hardest constraints we've had to deal with as we've improved Tailwind CSS over the years is the generated file size in development. Today I'm super excited to share a new project that makes this constraint a thing of the past: a just-in-time compiler for Tailwind CSS.

entry.title: Welcoming James McDonald to Tailwind Labs
entry.id: Welcoming James McDonald to Tailwind Labs
entry.summary: Many years ago I got a message from Steve that said something like: "Have I ever shared this guy's Dribbble profile with you before? Been following him forever, some of my absolute favorite work I've ever found." That person was James McDonald, and today we're totally over the moon to share that James is joining our team full-time.

entry.title: "Tailwind CSS: From Zero to Production" on YouTube
entry.id: "Tailwind CSS: From Zero to Production" on YouTube
entry.summary: Today we're excited to release Tailwind CSS: From Zero to Production, a new screencast series that teaches you everything you need to know to go from zero to production with Tailwind CSS v2.0.

entry.title: Welcoming David Luhr to Tailwind Labs
entry.id: Welcoming David Luhr to Tailwind Labs
entry.summary: We started working with David Luhr last summer to help us develop a Figma version of Tailwind UI, as well as to leverage his accessibility expertise, ensuring we were following best practices and delivering markup that would work for everyone. Today we're excited to share that David has joined the team full-time!

entry.title: Multi-line truncation with @tailwindcss/line-clamp
entry.id: Multi-line truncation with @tailwindcss/line-clamp
entry.summary: A few weeks back we released @tailwindcss/line-clamp, an official Tailwind CSS plugin for truncating text to a specific number of lines.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v2.0
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v2.0
entry.summary: Today we're finally releasing Tailwind CSS v2.0, including an all-new color palette, dark mode support, and tons more!

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v1.9.0
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v1.9.0
entry.summary: We just released Tailwind CSS v1.9 which adds support for configuration presets, useful new CSS grid utilities, extended border radius, rotate, and skew scales, helpful accessibility improvements, and more!

entry.title: Introducing Tailwind Play
entry.id: Introducing Tailwind Play
entry.summary: Tailwind Play is an advanced online playground for Tailwind CSS that lets you use all of Tailwind's build-time features directly in the browser.

entry.title: Headless UI: Unstyled, Accessible UI Components
entry.id: Headless UI: Unstyled, Accessible UI Components
entry.summary: Headless UI is a set of completely unstyled, fully accessible UI components for React, Vue, and Alpine.js that make it easy to build fully accessible custom UI components, without sacrificing the ability to style them from scratch with simple utility classes.

entry.title: "What's new in Tailwind CSS?" on YouTube
entry.id: "What's new in Tailwind CSS?" on YouTube
entry.summary: A lot of cool stuff has been added to Tailwind since the last time we published any screencasts, so we thought it would be a great idea to record a little series that covers all of the new additions.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v1.8.0
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v1.8.0
entry.summary: Tailwind CSS v1.8.0 is now available, with font-variant-numeric support, experimental dark mode, and more!

entry.title: Utility-Friendly Transitions with @tailwindui/react
entry.id: Utility-Friendly Transitions with @tailwindui/react
entry.summary: Announcing the first release of @tailwindui/react, which introduces a <Transition> component for utility-first enter/leave transitions.

entry.title: Introducing Heroicons.com
entry.id: Introducing Heroicons.com
entry.summary: Today we're launching the official Heroicons web experience, which makes it easier than ever to search for icons and quickly copy them to your clipboard as Tailwind-ready HTML or JSX.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v1.7.0
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v1.7.0
entry.summary: Tailwind CSS v1.7.0 is now available, with gradients and more!

entry.title: From Nine Hundred to One: How We Hired Robin Malfait
entry.id: From Nine Hundred to One: How We Hired Robin Malfait
entry.summary: Back in May we published our first job posting for a full-stack developer to join our team. This is the story of how we worked through almost 900 applications, and eventually hired Robin Malfait, a talented developer from Belgium who is starting with us today.

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v1.6.0
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v1.6.0
entry.summary: Tailwind CSS v1.6.0 is now available, with animations and more!

entry.title: Simon Vrachliotis Joins Tailwind Labs
entry.id: Simon Vrachliotis Joins Tailwind Labs
entry.summary: Today we are super excited to share that Simon Vrachliotis has joined the development team at Tailwind Labs.

entry.title: Welcoming Brad Cornes to the Team
entry.id: Welcoming Brad Cornes to the Team
entry.summary: Back in June, Brad Cornes joined our company as our very first team member. We didn't have a blog to announce it back then, but better late than never right?

entry.title: Tailwind CSS v1.5.0
entry.id: Tailwind CSS v1.5.0
entry.summary: Tailwind CSS v1.5.0 is here, now with component variants, responsive container variants, focus-visible support, and more.

entry.title: Introducing Tailwind CSS Typography
entry.id: Introducing Tailwind CSS Typography
entry.summary: Until now, trying to style an article, document, or blog post with Tailwind has been a tedious task that required a keen eye for typography and a lot of complex custom CSS. That's why today we're excited to release @tailwindcss/typography — a plugin that lets you easily style vanilla HTML content with beautiful typographic defaults.

entry.title: Building the Tailwind Blog with Next.js
entry.id: Building the Tailwind Blog with Next.js
entry.summary: One of the things we believe as a team is that everything we make should be sealed with a blog post. Forcing ourselves to write up a short announcement post for every project we work on acts as a built-in quality check, making sure that we never call a project "done" until we feel comfortable telling the world it's out there. The problem was that up until today, we didn't actually have anywhere to publish those posts!

entry.title: Introducing linting for Tailwind CSS IntelliSense
entry.id: Introducing linting for Tailwind CSS IntelliSense
entry.summary: Today we’re releasing a new version of the Tailwind CSS IntelliSense extension for Visual Studio Code that adds Tailwind-specific linting to both your CSS and your markup.
